p: The two species of insects were sampled from laboratory colonies. They were maintained in dark incubators at 28–30 °C and 70–80% relative humidity. L. serricorne were reared on wheat flour at 12–13% moisture content mixed with yeast (10:1, w/ w). L. bostrychophila were bred on a mixture of milk powder, active yeast, and flour (1:1:10, w/ w/ w). The mixed-sex adults about 1 week old were used in all bioassays.
